intro: Minuartia kabirarum, commonly known as the rock sandwort, is a small, mat-forming flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, white or pink flowers that bloom in the summer. Native to rocky and arid environments, this plant is adapted to thrive in harsh, sun-exposed conditions. It is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, growing on rock surfaces or in crevices. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens or as an ornamental plant.
